If you perform a lot of cooking with herbs, you should be able to have fresh herbs on demand. You get to choose what to grow from a wide variety of herbs. ;Using this method your herbs will likely be fresh and you won't have to pay for them at the grocery store. When you first start out, you may want to plant basil, dill, mint, sage, chives, rosemary or parsley. It's advisable that the garden soil you use for your herbs is able to drain out the water so it won't sit and cause your herbs to rot. If there is a drainage issue, you may want to drill down roughly a foot deep and layer it with crushed rocks then add soil. The water will be able to drain appropriately and your plants will quickly grow well.
;
;It's usually a bad idea to buy more expensive plants when you first start out growing your garden. It's really a better idea to simply grow your herbs from a seed and it is more affordable. A number of herbs grow very quickly, like mint and you will not likely wait long to have a garden full of mint. When it comes to most of these herbs, it is best to grow them in pots instead of in the regular garden. Since you worked hard to grow your herbs, you have to be careful when you harvest them. When the plants aren't healthy enough, they may die if you start picking on the leaves.
;
